pageProps.body:
Vectors

General Information

Definition

Entities that possess both a direction and magnitude.

  • Magnitude: strength of force
  • Direction: direction of force

Calc 3 Definition

A directed line segment

Notation

  • PQ⃗\vec{PQ}PQ​
    • Extends from point P to point Q
  • P=(1,5)P = (1,5)P=(1,5)
    • Position vector of ⟨1,5⟩\langle 1,5 \rangle⟨1,5⟩

Position Vectors

The position vector of point P in the coordinate plane is the vector of OP⃗\vec{OP}OP from the origin to the point PPP

Algebraic Operations

Addition

Tip to Tail method

U⃗+V⃗=⟨U1+V1+U2,V2⟩\vec{U}+\vec{V}=\langle U_1+V_1+U_2,V_2\rangleU+V=⟨U1​+V1​+U2​,V2​⟩

Example

From Problems
Go to text →
  1. A⃗=⟨1,2⟩\vec{A}=\langle 1,2 \rangleA=⟨1,2⟩
  2. B⃗=⟨3,2⟩\vec{B}=\langle 3,2 \rangleB=⟨3,2⟩
  3. A⃗+B⃗=⟨1,2⟩+⟨3,2⟩=⟨4,4⟩\vec{A}+\vec{B}=\langle 1,2 \rangle +\langle 3,2 \rangle = \langle 4,4 \rangleA+B=⟨1,2⟩+⟨3,2⟩=⟨4,4⟩

Scalar Multiplication

If cϵI ⁣Rc \epsilon {\rm I\!R}cϵIR, cA⃗c\vec{A}cA is defined to be the vector that is ∣c∣|c|∣c∣ times as long as A⃗\vec{A}A, in the same direction as A⃗\vec{A}A idf c>0c>0c>0 and in the opposite direction if C<0C<0C<0

Example

From Problems
Go to text →
  1. A⃗=⟨1,2⟩\vec{A} = \langle 1,2 \rangleA=⟨1,2⟩
  2. 2A⃗=2∗⟨1,2⟩=⟨2,4⟩2\vec{A}= 2*\langle 1,2 \rangle =\langle 2,4 \rangle2A=2∗⟨1,2⟩=⟨2,4⟩

Finding Magnitude

Pythagorean Theorem

Example

From Problems
Go to text →

Find ∣A⃗∣|\vec{A}|∣A∣ when A⃗=⟨2,3⟩\vec{A} = \langle 2,3 \rangleA=⟨2,3⟩

∣A⃗∣=22+32=13|\vec{A}|= \sqrt{2^2+3^2} =\sqrt{13}∣A∣=22+32​=13​

Unit Vector

Definition

A vector of length 1

Example

Given a vector A⃗=⟨2,3⟩\vec{A} = \langle 2,3 \rangleA=⟨2,3⟩, can you find a unit vector in the same direction.

Steps To Find

  1. find ∣A⃗∣|\vec{A}|∣A∣
  2. A⃗∣A⃗∣\frac{\vec{A}}{|\vec{A}|}∣A∣A​

Limit Vectors

  • iii ➡️ ⟨1,0⟩\langle 1,0 \rangle⟨1,0⟩
  • jjj ➡️ ⟨0,1⟩\langle 0,1 \rangle⟨0,1⟩

Example

u=⟨−5,6⟩u = \langle -5,6 \rangleu=⟨−5,6⟩ ➡️ u=−5i+6ju=-5i+6ju=−5i+6j j=⟨3,2⟩j = \langle 3,2 \ranglej=⟨3,2⟩ ➡️ u=3i+2ju=3i+2ju=3i+2j

Vectors in 3D Space

Definition

A vector in space I ⁣R3{\rm I\!R}^3IR3

Notation

  • (x,y,z)(x,y,z)(x,y,z)

Magnitude of 3D Vector

∣v⃗∣=v12+v22+v32|\vec{v}| = \sqrt{v_1^2+v_2^2+v_3^2}∣v∣=v12​+v22​+v32​​

Limit Vectors in 3D space

  • iii ➡️ ⟨1,0,0⟩\langle 1,0,0 \rangle⟨1,0,0⟩
  • jjj ➡️ ⟨0,1,0⟩\langle 0,1,0 \rangle⟨0,1,0⟩
  • kkk ➡️ ⟨0,0,1⟩\langle 0,0,1 \rangle⟨0,0,1⟩

Distance Between 3D Vectors

Represented as P1P2→\overrightarrow{P_1P_2}P1​P2​​

  • P1P2→=⟨(x2−x1),(y2−y1),(z2−z1)⟩\overrightarrow{P_1P_2} = \langle (x_2-x_1), (y_2-y_1), (z_2-z_1) \rangleP1​P2​​=⟨(x2​−x1​),(y2​−y1​),(z2​−z1​)⟩
  • P1P2→=(x2−x1)i+(y2−y1)j+(z2−z1)k\overrightarrow{P_1P_2} = (x_2-x_1)i + (y_2-y_1)j + (z_2-z_1)kP1​P2​​=(x2​−x1​)i+(y2​−y1​)j+(z2​−z1​)k

Finding Length

∣fP1P2→∣=(x2−x1)2+(y2−y1)2+(z2−z1)2|f\overrightarrow{P_1P_2}| = \sqrt{(x_2-x_1)^2 + (y_2-y_1)^2 + (z_2-z_1)^2}∣fP1​P2​​∣=(x2​−x1​)2+(y2​−y1​)2+(z2​−z1​)2​

Circles/Spheres

Equation for 2D Circle

(x−x0)2+(y−y0)2=r2(x-x_0)^2+(y-y_0)^2=r^2(x−x0​)2+(y−y0​)2=r2

Equation for 3D Sphere

(x−x0)2+(y−y0)2+(z−z0)2=r2(x-x_0)^2+(y-y_0)^2+ (z-z_0)^2=r^2(x−x0​)2+(y−y0​)2+(z−z0​)2=r2

Example

From Problems
Go to text →

Find description of the points that lie on the intersection of the sphere x2+y2+z2=36x^2+y^2+z^2=36x2+y2+z2=36 and the plane z=6z=6z=6

Steps

  1. Find the center
    1. Located at (0,0,0)(0,0,0)(0,0,0)
  2. Plug plane values into sphere equation
    1. x2+y2+62=36x^2+y^2+6^2=36x2+y2+62=36
    2. x2+y2=0x^2+y^2=0x2+y2=0
  3. Solve For Possible xxx and yyy equations
    1. x=0x=0x=0
    2. y=0y=0y=0
  4. Answer
    1. (0,0,6)(0,0,6)(0,0,6)

Children
  1. Problems
  2. Products

note-this-site-is-no-longer-being-update.text: Note: This site is no longer being updated

noteIndex.body:
## Adam's Knowledge Base

![Picture of me](/assets/images/adam.jpg){max-width: 150px, display: block, margin: 0}

## About Me

I am an undergraduate at **The** Ohio State University studying Computer Science & Engineering. I love cutting edge technology, especially when used it's for Automation, Startups, and Data Analytics.

Some other hobbies of mine include competing on the [OSU Club Wrestling Team](https://ncwa.net/teams/osu), coordinating events for the [Big Data Analytical Association](https://bdaaosu.org/), and whatever [[I'm currently working on|what-im-doing]]. I'm always looking for cool stuff to work on so please reach out if you're making of learning something interesting.

## What This Site Is

One big issue I have is that I tend to find a lot of great resources for learning a topic, but lose the, due to disorganization. To combat this pesky issue, I created this site as sort of a second brain to store things of interest. This site contains everything from my class notes to vim guides. If you would like anything added, feel free to send me an email.

## Links

- **[Github](https://github.com/aglucky)**
- **[Resume](/assets/gluck_resume.pdf)**
- **[LinkedIn](https://www.linkedin.com/in/adam-gluck-111a2a174/)**
- **Email: Adam.gluck10@gmail.com**

## Note: This site is no longer being updated
